reviewText: I admit it, I watched JEM back in its heyday (or perhaps even a little afterward as my memories of it are the reruns on USA).  It was the glitz, glam and excess of the 80s wrapped up into a glamorous hot pink package that makes an army of Barbie dolls look mudane and typical in comparision.  Jem was like Rock Star Barbie, and the episodes for this series generally revolved around concerts, fashion, making music videos and hot sports cars, and of course the Vixen crossed with Taylor Dayne, dance inducing electric edged pop rock music that went along with it.She-Ra provided little girls of the 80s with a strong female heroine to look up to for their fantasy otherworldly fix, while JEM provided the "I wanna be a rock star" fantasy rolled up into made for tv animation.  It wasn't brilliance but it was definitely a nice fix for weekday afternoons.  Want to relive the nostalgia? Well here you go.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Here I was one day sitting at the computer looking through websites of 80's cartoons for an article I had to write for the school paper. I saw a link saying Jem and the Holograms; it sounded vaguely familiar...so I clicked it! Then there she was in all her glory! I had completely forgotten about her until this point and then the floodgates of my memory were washed away once I saw the picture of her. At that moment I was hooked. I hurried over to my local suncoast video and quickly ordered this video...to my delight, Rhino had just re-released Jem on video. I would just like to say that this cartoon really is outstanding...especially with most of the cartoons they have out today! The music really grows on you and the animation is marvelous, it reeks of glamour and glitter! Jem served as a role model for many girls in the 80's and children today can still relate to her. She promotes strength, intellect, and independence...while enteraining teaching and morals. This video is worth more than its weight in gold. For some great memories, good music, and delightful plots I would not hesitate to recommend this video!
summary: What more can I say...this video is Truly Outrageous!

reviewText: I love this cartoon I used to watch this cartoon all the time when I was a kid this was one of the best cartoons in the 1980's and Jem she really jammed she dressed fabulously and she had a boyfriend that loved her and she had her someone who looked over her "Synergy" always helped her out whenever she needed help and she had rivals also Eric Raymond and Pizazz and the Misfits if you liked JEM in the 1980's then I would truly recommend that you purchase this video because it is the same people and the same script you will be very happy that you bought this video ; also, if you like rock and roll music or rock and roll cartoons then this is a must have for you!!!
summary: Jem is truly, truly, truly outrageous!!!!

reviewText: Although I am a guy, "Jem" was one of my favorite cartoon series while growing up in New York City. Airing almost weekday morning at 8am on Channel 11, "Jem" was shown right before the station aired my favorite cartoon series, "The Transformers." "Jem" was Hasbro's answer to Mattel's ever-popular "Barbie" toy line, and unlike the latter, "Jem" was truly more fascinating and interesting."Jem - Vol. 2: Fashion Fiasco" contains two episodes "Stitches" and "Culture Clash." In the first episode, Jem and her band, the Holograms, travel to Venice, where bandmate Shana has entered her designs in a fashion contest. As usual, trouble shows its' ugly head as their rivals, the Misfits, also travel to Venice to enter the contest and cause havoc.In "Culture Clash," the band travels to New York to film a video with one of the top avant-garde director out there. While not quite Andy Warhol, this director has an unusual way of annoying the band. However, when he is linked with a series of jewel robberies, the band gets involved to help clear his name.It's great that Rhino Video has released this series and many other cartoon shows based of Hasbro toy lines (e.g., "The Transformers"; "G.I. Joe"; etc....). I hope they decided to release more of "Jem" on video, and hopefully on DVD in the near future.
summary: Classic Cartoon Based on the Hasbro Toy Line

reviewText: How could you not like this? I love all of the Jem cartoons. It is a flashback to your youth! My niece even saw this and said she wanted to be just like Jem. Good, pretty, and nice. I think this is a great cartoon for the younger generation! You might be surprised how much they like it! If you enjoy a good cartoon, pick this one up!
